Sentencas: The direct use of methane as fuel for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) without pre-reforming would reduce running costs and enable higher efficiencies.
Titulo: Sensitivity of nickel cermet anodes to reduction conditions

Sentencas: But methane generally causes carbon deposition on the nickel anode and subsequent power degradation.
Titulo: Sensitivity of nickel cermet anodes to reduction conditions

Sentencas: This paper shows that carbon deposition from methane is very sensitive to anode reduction conditions.
Titulo: Sensitivity of nickel cermet anodes to reduction conditions

Sentencas: The effect of direct methane on microtubular SOFC reduced at two different conditions was studied at temperatures above 800 degrees C. Reducing the cells at high temperature gave good performance on hydrogen but the current degraded quickly on methane, suggesting that carbon was blocking the nickel surfaces.
Titulo: Sensitivity of nickel cermet anodes to reduction conditions

Sentencas: This was not recoverable by bringing in hydrogen to replace the methane.
Titulo: Sensitivity of nickel cermet anodes to reduction conditions

Sentencas: Cells reduced under low temperature conditions gave higher current on methane than on hydrogen, showing that carbon deposited from the methane improved nickel anode conductivity in this case.
Titulo: Sensitivity of nickel cermet anodes to reduction conditions

Sentencas: These cells also did not degrade on methane under certain conditions but lasted for a long period.
Titulo: Sensitivity of nickel cermet anodes to reduction conditions

Sentencas: Extracting the carbon by feeding the cell with hydrogen interrupted this newly formed linkage between the nickel particles, reducing the electrical conductivity, which could be recovered by reintroducing methane.
Titulo: Sensitivity of nickel cermet anodes to reduction conditions

Sentencas: The conclusion was that nickel cermet anodes are very sensitive to reduction conditions, with low temperature reduction being preferred if methane is to be used as the chosen fuel.
Titulo: Sensitivity of nickel cermet anodes to reduction conditions
